MonitoringLocationName: COAL CK BLW ELK CK
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: W. of Crested Butte , Drive through Crested Butte west and up Kebler pass (12 Rd.). Go approx. 4 miles up, just past an old homestead cabin to a road that crosses the creek and has a view looking downstream/ east of the cabin. The confl. Of Elk Cr. Is a quarter mile up the road west from here. Sample ups. culvert on the left bank.
HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

MonitoringLocationName: COAL CK ABV SLATE RIVER

HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

OrganizationFormalName: Colorado Dept. of Public Health & Environment
MonitoringLocationName: OH-BE-JOYFUL CK ABV THE SLATE R
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: NW of Crested Butte, go 3.2 mi. to Oh Be Joyful C.G. , cross the creek with a high clearance car and continue on for about a half mile, then walk directly south to the Creek and sample from the right (north) bank (Looking Upstream).

OrganizationFormalName: Colorado Dept. of Public Health & Environment
MonitoringLocationName: REDWELL BASIN AT MOUTH
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: NW of Crested Butte, go 3.2 mi. to Oh Be Joyful C.G. , cross the creek with a high clearance car and continue on the road until it is impassable then continue on foot. Go a total of about two miles from the river crossing up Oh Be Joyful Cr., look for a large avalanche chute on the left, cross Oh be Joyful at a safe spot, and find the largest channel in the avalanche chute. Site should be avoided in winter.

OrganizationFormalName: Colorado Dept. of Public Health & Environment
MonitoringLocationName: REDWELL BASIN U/S DAISY MINE D/S RED WELL SPRING
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: NW of Crested Butte. Go up the Slate R. (CR 734) approx. 3 miles, turn W. and S. following signs to Gunsight Pass. Cross the Slate R. (requires high clearance, low water and a well attached front license plate), follow the switchbacks aprrox. 7 miles to the Redwell basin. Sample u/s Daisy Mine and u/s Spring. (Site Description reads d/s of but site cannot be both above the mine and below the spring, see memo.)
HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

OrganizationFormalName: Colorado Dept. of Public Health & Environment
MonitoringLocationName: REDWELL BASIN D/S DAISY MINE AND SPRINGS
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Follow site directions for 10127B2 , then hike down from the road to below the confluence of the spring and the main channel, but above a second red spring/ seap.
HorizontalCollectionMethodName: GPS Code (Pseudo Range) Standard Position (SA Off)

MonitoringLocationName: Augusta Creek at mouth, above Poverty Gulch
Arsenic sampling site 1 on North Fork of Coal Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Coal Creek 8 meters upstream of confluence with unnamed tributary that enters from the south.  The mainstem of Coal Creek is surrounded by a willow complex. This site was established for the Preliminary As Study NPS project in 2012.

MonitoringLocationName: Arsenic sampling site 2 on South Fork of Coal Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: South fork of Coal Creek; 5 meters upstream of confluence with north fork of Coal Creek.  Cobble bottom for 5 meters then upstream sections are organic bottom

MonitoringLocationName: Lower Ender Mill arsenic sampling site 3
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Lower Ender Mill.  ~60 m North (downstream) of potential contamination source along edge of willow complex. Incised channel into organic soil, meandering and braided.

MonitoringLocationName: Upper Ender Mill arsenic sampling site 3
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Upper Ender Mill.  Upstream of potential contamination source, approximately 50 m SE of bare earth area.  Incised channel through willow complex.

MonitoringLocationName: Arsenic sampling site OPP
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Culvert connecting the triangle of land between Kebler Pass Road and the road to Irwin.  Taken downstream of road.  Upstream of road=impounded wetland, downstream of road=small cobble channel

MonitoringLocationName: Baxter Creek at mouth, above Poverty Gulch
Bog drainage upstream of Kebler Pass Road and Coal Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Bog drainage (a local name for an unnamed tributary to Coal Creek that drains a small portion of the southern flank of Mt. Emmons, the wagon road ditch, which is breached in several locations also contributes flow to the tributary) sampled upstream of the culvert on Kebler Pass road.  The Wagon Road Trail begins about 180 feet west of the BOG-00 site and their is a small parking spot right next to the site.

MonitoringLocationName: Gossan and Keystone hill-slope drainage; sampled on the south side of Kebler Pass Road.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: The drainage crosses under Kebler Pass road about 40 meters upstream of mile marker 29. Sample on the south side of Kebler Pass road.

MonitoringLocationName: First unnamed tributary downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Rd; sample collected about 5 m above rd. The site is approximately 100 m downstream of BOG-00 and 55 m upstream of CULVERT #1. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.

Second unnamed tributary/seep downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Road; sample collected about 5 m above rd.  The site is approximately 135 m downstream of BOG-00 and about 20 m above CULVERT #2. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.

Third unnamed tributary downstream of BOG-00 above Kebler Pass Rd;  collected about 5 m above rd.  Flows from BOG-OPP-1, BOG-OPP-2, & BOG-OPP-3 combine in the ditch immediately above CULVERT #3. The water drains from a breached area on the fen ditch.
Drainage from the eastern portion of the wetland below the Fen Ditch. This tributary may provide flow to the lower BOG-OPP sites.
Drainage from the western portion of the wetland below the Fen Ditch. This tributary may provide flow to the lower BOG-OPP sites.
Bog tributary above the fen ditch.
Coal Creek above pedestrian bridge on Butte Ave.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: This location is also monitored by the USGS. The site is called: USGS 385224106590100 COAL CREEK ABOVE MOUTH AT CRESTED BUTTE, CO

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek at Totem Pole Park below the bridge and stormwater discharge
Coal Creek above Crested Butte and below irrigation diversions
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText:
Coal Creek upstream of town of Crested Butte on Kebler Pass Road. Before
crossing a bridge on County Road 12 make a left onto a dirt pull off just before the bridge. Creek access point is about 100 meters from the paved road.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek below Wildcat Trail bridge
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Coal Creek approximately 10 meters downstream of Wildcat Trail bridge. Access site at junction of Wildcat Trail Road and County Rd. 12.  Park at pull off alongside Wildcat Trail Road and hike down to site.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek above Wildcat Trail Bridge and below the Crested Butte water supply intake and the Keystone waste water treatment plant outfall
Coal Creek below Crested Butte water supply intake and above the Keystone WWTP Outfall
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Coal Creek approximately 100 meters upstream of Keystone Mine WWTF outfall.  Access site in the same way as Coal-05.  Look for two yellow-colored poles with blue tops that mark the drinking water intake.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek below input from KEY-CULVERT- which drains road and western portion of Keystone Mine Property.
Coal Creek above input from KEY_CULVERT- which drains road and western portion of Keystone Mine.
Coal Creek above Crested Butte water supply intake and Keystone WTP Outfall.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Stake along roadside 50 meters upstream of 4x4 road heading down to creek. This site is downstream of 3rd outfall possibly receiving inputs from the fen. Use 4X4 road for access. Site formerly called Bog-01.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek above the Mount Emmons Iron Fen and Gossan.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: One tenth of a mile upstream of BOG-00 outfall. There is a parking area on the south side of road. Follow small trail down to water. Look for two dead clusters of trees on south bank of stream.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek below confluence with Elk Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Coal Creek 100 meters downstream of Elk Creek confluence.  Sample where water is well-mixed. Look for 4X4 trail leaving parking lot to the south and east.  Look for stake by stream.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek at the first street bridge in Crested Butte, CO. Water quality samples are collected above the bridge and flow measurements are completed below the bridge at the staff gauge.
Coal Creek above Elk Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: From parking lot walk cross Elk Creek to the west bank and walk south to Coal Creek. A stake is in an opening approximately 20 meters upstream of a cluster of conifers at the confluence of Elk and Coal Creeks. Look for a leaning fir tree.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek about 50 meters above Splains Gulch Road, where the chip seal ends. Location established for the Kebler Pass Road magnesium chloride investigation.
Coal Creek below the confluence of Anthracite and Ruby Creeks, below  junction of roads to Lake Irwin, Ohio Creek and Kebler Pass summit.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Site is just upstream of culvert that underpasses the dirt road that forks south 500 meters before the Kebler Y.  3 meters upstream of Wagon Road.

MonitoringLocationName: North fork of Coal Creek near Kebler Pass "Y"
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: 40 m upstream of culvert where N fork of Coal Creek crosses Kebler Pass Rd downstream of "Y".  Straight channel parallel to road. Moderate gradient.

MonitoringLocationName: North fork of Coal Creek just upstream of Kebler Pass "Y"
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: 40 m NW of "Yield" signa at Kebler Y.  15 m upstream of small tributary.  Near large boulder in channel.  Meandering, incised, moderate gradient.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Creek below Irwin town site and the Forest Queen Mine
The largest/main tributary of Coal Creek, approximately 75 yards downstream of the last man-made Forest Queen Mine pond and below the Irwin Townsite.

First culvert downstream of BOG-00 and immediately below BOG-OPP-3. The culvert recieves flow from BOG-OPP-1, BOG-OPP-2, and BOG-OPP-3.  The culvert goes under Kebler Pass rd at BOG-OPP-3. The culvert is black corrugated plastic.

CULVERT #2 is about 190 m down from CULVERT #1. There are not typically surface tributaries between CULVERT #1 and CULVERT #2.  Groundwater seeps from the road cut-slope and water that by-passed CULVERT #1 create the flow at CULVERT #2.

Third culvert below BOG-00. There are not typically tributaries between CULVERT #2 & CULVERT #3. Groundwater seeps & dispersed surface flow create flow in the ditch immediatley downstream of CULVERT #2.

The fifth culvert downstream of BOG-00. There are two tributaries between CULVERT #4 and CULVERT #5. The second tributary accounts for about 80 percent of the flow at CULVERT #5. The second tributary likely drains a portion of the Gossan.
Discharge at lower collapsed adit of Elk Creek mine
Discharge at toe of Elk Creek Mine wasterock pile
Elk Creek near mouth above Kebler Pass Road and Coal Creek
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Elk Creek at Kebler Pass Road crossing approximately 100 meters upstream of confluence with Coal Creek, and about 10 meters above Kebler Pass Road.

MonitoringLocationName: Elk Creek downstream of Elk Creek mine influence
Elk Creek downstream of Standard Mine but upstream of Elk Creek Mine
Elk-15
Tributary east of Elk Creek near mouth above Kebler Pass Road and Coal Creek, flow originates in basin east of the Elk Creek drainage.
Evans Basin Tributary near mouth above Kebler Pass road and pedestrian bridge
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText:
Evans Basin Tributary near mouth above Kebler Pass road and pedestrian bridge. This tributary's flows originate on the hillside
and does not include flows from the roadside ditch.

MonitoringLocationName: Culvert outfall with flow from both the road ditch and Evans Basin hillslope
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Culvert outfall with flow from both the Kebler Pass road ditch and the Evans Basin hillslope. Flows under Kebler Pass Road via a culvertmarked by tall green metal stakes. This culvert receives flow from the west in theroadside ditch and from the Evans Basin hillside above the culvert.

MonitoringLocationName: First breach on the west end of the ditch used to direct runoff from the fen away from the Kebler Pass road cutslope.
Second breach from the west end of the ditch used to direct runoff from the fen away from the Kebler Pass road cutslope.

Outflow from the pond at the center of the fen.

Groundwater spring, sampled on the surface, southwest of the fen pond inflow.
Groundwater spring, sampled on the surface, near the fen pond (formerly referred to as small round spring).

Location of batteries at the Forest Queen Mine removed in 2009.  Site is approximately 50 feet south of adit to Forest Queen Mine.
Pond of Coal Creek adjacent to the tressle.
Pond downstream of the Silver Queen and Silver King Mines. FQM- Pond 2 is the downstream pond of 3 ponds found about 20 meters from the Irwin Townsite Road.
Pond downstream of the Silver Queen and Silver King Mines. FQM- Pond 3 is the middle pond of 3 ponds found about 20 meters from the Irwin Townsite Road.
Pond downstream of the Silver Queen and Silver King Mines. FQM- Pond 4 is the upper pond of 3 ponds found about 20 meters from the Irwin Townsite Road.
Pond downstream of the Silver Queen and Silver King Mines. FQM- Pond 5 is east of ponds 3 and 4.
Pond downstream of the Silver Queen and Silver King Mines. FQM- Pond 7 is upgradient of the other ponds and nearest to the mine adits.

MonitoringLocationName: Drainage from the gossan complex, above Kebler Pass road. The tributary flows under Kebler Pass road at CULVERT #5.

Western drainage from the gossan complex and adit wetland, above Kebler Pass road. The tributary flows under Kebler Pass road at CULVERT #5. The site is about 60 meters west of GOSSAN-00 on Kebler Pass Road.
Drainage from the gossan at the bottom of the debris flow. The drainage flows to GOSSAN-00.

Park across from the pumphouse along the trees' edge and walk about 50 meters east along the trees to find the flume.

MonitoringLocationName: Keystone WWTP Outfall Drainage.
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Key-00 flows separate into two flows about 15 meters up the hillside from Kebler Pass Road. Key-01 is the left (western) fork of the drainage and contains the discharge from the WWTP.

Peanut Mine - PM Adit Above Tailings
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: From Crested Butte go north on Peanut Lake Road to Peanut Mine (couple of miles).  Sample is taken from the flow of water coming out of the mine (adit).  This adit flow starts in section 27 and flows into Peanut Lake in section 34. Sample is above tailings pile.

MonitoringLocationName: Peanut Mine - PM Adit Below Tailings
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: From Crested Butte take the Peanut Lake Road and travel to the Peanut Lake Mine almost.  The stream into Peanut Lake is the mine adit flow from Peanut Mine. Sample the inlet before the flow goes into the Lake but below the tailings pile.

MonitoringLocationName: Coal Cr - Abv Conf Slate
MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: From Crested Butte take County Road 317 (Gothic Road) towards Crested Butte Mountain. After about one mile turn left on Slate River Road (first left after bridge). Turn left to the confluence with Coal Cr. Take sample on Coal Cr above confluence with Slate R.

MonitoringLocationName: Peanut Lk - Peanut Lk W Side

MonitoringLocationName: Elk Cr - Elk Cr

MonitoringLocationDescriptionText: Start at the intersection of 1st Street and CR 12 in Crested Butte. Go 4.5 miles towards Keebler Pass, sampling point on south side of the road.
